hints_html:
Computing this determinant based on the first column is the best route.

Remember that

\(\displaystyle \text{det}(A^{3}) = \text{det}(A) ^{3}\)
hints_latex: Computing this determinant based on the first column is the best route.
hints_raw:
Computing this determinant based on the first column is the best route.
Remember that 

<math>\displaystyle \text{det}(A^{3}) = \text{det}(A) ^{3}</math>
sols_html:
Using the definition of a determinant along the first column, we have

\[\begin{aligned} \text{det}(A) &= 0\cdot \begin{vmatrix} 8 &3 &1 \\ -1 &-4 &3 \\ 2& 3 &1 \end{vmatrix}+(-1)(-2)\cdot \begin{vmatrix} 2 &3 &-1 \\ -1 &-4 &3 \\ 2& 3 &1 \end{vmatrix} + 0\cdot \begin{vmatrix} 2 &3 &-1 \\ 8 &3 &1 \\ 2& 3 &1 \end{vmatrix} + 0\cdot \begin{vmatrix} 2 &3 &-1 \\ 8 &3 &1 \\ -1& -4 &3 \end{vmatrix}\\ &= (2)[(2)(-4)(1)+(-1)(3)(-1)+(2)(3)(3)-(-1)(-4)(2)-(3)(-1)(1)-(2)(3)(3)] \\ &= (2)(-10) \\ &= -20\end{aligned}\]

As

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle \text{det}(A^{3}) = \text{det}(A)^{3}\end{aligned}\]

we see that

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle \text{det}(A^{3}) = (-20) ^{3} = -8000\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
Using the definition of a determinant along the first column, we have

:<math> 
\begin{align}
\text{det}(A) &= 0\cdot \begin{vmatrix}
8 &3 &1 \\ 
-1 &-4 &3 \\ 
2& 3 &1 
\end{vmatrix}+(-1)(-2)\cdot \begin{vmatrix}
2 &3 &-1 \\ 
-1 &-4 &3 \\ 
2& 3 &1 
\end{vmatrix} + 0\cdot \begin{vmatrix}
2 &3 &-1 \\ 
8 &3 &1 \\ 
2& 3 &1 
\end{vmatrix} + 0\cdot \begin{vmatrix}
2 &3 &-1 \\ 
8 &3 &1 \\ 
-1& -4 &3 
\end{vmatrix}\\
& = (2)[(2)(-4)(1)+(-1)(3)(-1)+(2)(3)(3)-(-1)(-4)(2)-(3)(-1)(1)-(2)(3)(3)] \\
&= (2)(-10) \\
&= -20
\end{align}
</math>


As

:<math>\displaystyle \text{det}(A^{3}) = \text{det}(A)^{3}</math> 

we see that 

:<math>\displaystyle \text{det}(A^{3}) = (-20) ^{3} = -8000</math>
statement_html:
Consider the matrix \(A = \begin{bmatrix} 0 &2 &3 & -1\\ -2& 8& 3 &1 \\ 0& -1 & -4 &3 \\ 0& 2 &3 &1 \end{bmatrix}\)

Compute det(\(A\)) and det(\(A^{3}\))
statement_latex:
Consider the matrix $A = \begin{bmatrix}
0 &2 &3 & -1\\ 
-2& 8& 3 &1 \\ 
0& -1 & -4 &3 \\ 
0& 2 &3 &1 
\end{bmatrix}$

Compute det($A$) and det($A^{3}$)
statement_raw:
Consider the matrix <math>A = \begin{bmatrix}
0 &2 &3 & -1\\ 
-2& 8& 3 &1 \\ 
0& -1 & -4 &3 \\ 
0& 2 &3 &1 
\end{bmatrix}</math>

Compute det(<math>A</math>) and det(<math>A^{3}</math>)
